title: Naoki Sugai
text:
is a former <a href="Japanese%20people">Japanese</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Sugai was born in <a href="Yamagata%2C%20Yamagata">Yamagata</a> on 21 September 1984. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Vegalta%20Sendai">Vegalta Sendai</a> in 2003. He could not play at all in the match and Vegalta was relegated <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> end of <a href="2003%20J.League%20Division%201">2003 season</a>. He played many matches as defensive midfielder from 2004. In 2006, he was converted to right side back under new manager <a href="Joel%20Santana">Joel Santana</a> and played many matches as regular player for a long time. Vegalta won the champions in <a href="2009%20J.League%20Division%202">2009 season</a> and was promoted to J1. 
Although <a href="2011%20T%C5%8Dhoku%20earthquake%20and%20tsunami">2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami</a> occurred in Sendai immediately after the opening <a href="2011%20J.League%20Division%201">2011 season</a>, Vegalta finished at the 4th place which is best results in the club history. In <a href="2012%20J.League%20Division%201">2012 season</a>, Vegalta won the 2nd place and qualified for <a href="2013%20AFC%20Champions%20League">2013 AFC Champions League</a>. His opportunity to play decreased behind <a href="Kazuki%20Oiwa">Kazuki Oiwa</a> from 2016. He retired end of 2018 season.
